transcripts.text: Law 29.  Plan all the way to the end.  The ending is everything.  Plan all the way to it, taking into account all the possible consequences, obstacles, and twists of fortune that might reverse your hard work and give the glory to others.  By planning to the end, you will not be overwhelmed by circumstances and you will know when to stop.  Gently guide fortune and help determine the future by thinking far ahead.  As human beings, we count our future in hours, days and weeks and we rarely account for longer periods of time.  Even when we triumph over impulses, we relapse once and again and remain trapped forever, viewing the world through our mortal and temporary lenses.  And thus we become victims of fortune.  Unlike the gods of Mount Olympus, who have the power to foresee the future, we live as slaves to our desires, focused only on the moment, treasuring and lasting over the tribal leftovers.  You, on the other hand, you must plan all the way to the end.  Observance of the Law.  Lyndon Johnson was an ambitious young congressman who grew to become one of the most.
